entry.tran: (人或动物)悄悄地缓慢行进，蹑手蹑脚地移动
entry.def: When people or animals creep somewhere, they move quietly and slowly.

example.ex: Back I go to the hotel and creep up to my room...
example.tran: 我回到旅馆，蹑手蹑脚地上楼回到房间。

example.ex: The rabbit creeps away and hides in a hole.
example.tran: 兔子悄悄溜走，藏进洞里。

entry.def: If something creeps somewhere, it moves very slowly.

example.ex: Mist had crept in again from the sea.
example.tran: 薄雾又从海面上弥漫过来了。

entry.def: If something creeps in or creeps back, it begins to occur or becomes part of something without people realizing or without them wanting it.

example.tran: 可能会不知不觉地产生不安全感。

example.ex: An increasing ratio of mistakes, perhaps induced by tiredness, crept into her game.
example.tran: 可能是由于体力不支，她在比赛中的失误越来越多。

entry.def: If a rate or number creeps up to a higher level, it gradually reaches that level.

example.ex: The inflation rate has been creeping up to 9.5 per cent...
The average number of students in each class is creeping up from three to four.
example.tran: 每个班的平均学生人数已经从3人增长到了4人。

entry.tran: 讨厌鬼; (尤指)讨好卖乖的人，马屁精
entry.def: If you describe someone as a creep, you mean that you dislike them a great deal, especially because they are insincere and flatter people.

entry.tran: 吓人;使惊慌;使心里发毛
entry.def: If someone or something gives you the creeps, they make you feel very nervous or frightened.

example.ex: I always hated that statue. It gave me the creeps.
example.tran: 我一直都很讨厌那座雕像。它让我心里发毛。

means.word_mean: 1. a disease of cattle and sheep attributed to a dietary deficiency; characterized by anemia and softening of the bones and a slow stiff gait
2. a feeling of fear and revulsion;

auth_sentence.content: The problem starts in the legs and creeps upwards.
auth_sentence.res_content: The problem starts in the legs and creeps upwards.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The problem starts in the legs and creeps upwards.

auth_sentence.content: Yet none of that bitterness creeps into his music.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet none of that bitterness creeps into his music.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet none of that bitterness creeps into his music.

auth_sentence.content: Quite frankly, the country gives me the creeps.
auth_sentence.res_content: Quite frankly, the country gives me the creeps.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Quite frankly, the country gives me the creeps.
